title: Association Between Dyslipidemia and Lichen Planus: A Cross-Sectional Study in a Tertiary Care Hospital
summary: A medical research study examining the relationship between dyslipidemia and lichen planus conducted at a tertiary care hospital. The study appears to be a cross-sectional analysis investigating the connection between these two conditions.
content:
The research investigates the potential association between dyslipidemia, a condition characterized by abnormal blood lipid levels, and lichen planus, an inflammatory skin condition. The study was conducted in a tertiary care hospital setting using a cross-sectional methodology to analyze patient data and establish possible correlations between these two medical conditions.

The research appears to be aimed at understanding the relationship between metabolic disorders and autoimmune skin conditions, which could have implications for patient care and treatment approaches.

source.title: Association Between Dyslipidemia and Lichen Planus: A Cross-Sectional Study in a Tertiary Care Hospital
